description.plain:
Lontrell Dennell Williams, Jr. (b. November 8, 1999), professionally known as Pooh Shiesty, is an American rapper and songwriter who hails from Memphis, Tennessee. Signed to Atlantic Records and Gucci Mane’s record label, 1017 Eskimo, he released all of his songs through the two labels.

Shiesty first was brought to fame from his feature on Gucci’s single, “Still Remember,” which was released on June 19, 2020. He contributed to songs on Gucci’s respective fourth and fifth compilation albums, So Icy Summer and So Icy Gang, Vol. 1, both projects having a multitude of artists as part of the “New 1017,” or artists recently signed to 1017.

On November 6, 2020, Shiesty released his hit breakout single “Back in Blood,” featuring Lil Durk, which was certified platinum by the RIAA and gave him his first single to chart anywhere. The song appeared as the lead single on his debut mixtape, Shiesty Season, his first project, which was released on February 5, 2021. Shiesty is also featured on SpotemGottem’s December 2020 hit single, “Beat Box 2,” which had almost the same commercial success as “Back in Blood.”

songs.title: Back in Blood

description.plain:
Pooh Shiesty enlists Lil Durk for “Back in Blood,” which serves as the lead single off of the former’s debut mixtape, Shiesty Season. They rap about murders around them, boasting about their respective weaponry on this YC-produced song.

The song was released the same day Durk’s close friend and fellow labelmate King Von tragically died after being shot outside a nightclub in Atlanta, Georgia. Von was also supposed to be featured on the now-scrapped remix of Shiesty’s July 2020 song, “7.62 God.”

The official music video for the song was released on January 2, 2021, taking place in the 6400 block of South Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Drive, a tribute to Von and his home block.

songs.full_title: 7.62 God by Pooh Shiesty
songs.title: 7.62 God

description.plain:
On “7.62 God” , Shiesty discusses his weaponry, as well as his legal trouble with police and authorities. He also drops a line about the COVID-19 pandemic, which was going on at the time of this track’s release.

The track was released on Shiesty’s YouTube channel on April 19, 2020, alongside its official music video. It later found an official release on July 3, 2020, being featured on Shiesty’s 1017 Eskimo label boss Gucci Mane’s fourth compilation album, So Icy Summer.

songs.full_title: Neighbors by Pooh Shiesty (Ft. BIG30)
songs.title: Neighbors

description.plain:
Pooh Shiesty reunites with BIG30 for “Neighbors,” the third and final single off of Shiesty Season, released two days before the mixtape. The two later collaborate again on the same LP along with Veeze on the song “Making a Mess.”

The two artists rap about their weaponry and the expensive purchases that they make. Containing a fast-paced instrumental, produced by C-Mo, they boast about their hedonistic lifestyles.

The official music video for the song premiered along with the full project on February 5, 2021.

songs.title_with_featured: Main Slime (Remix) (Ft. Moneybagg Yo & Tay Keith)

description.plain:
On the remix to “Main Slime,” Shiesty enlists the help of Moneybagg Yo and Tay Keith for two new verses. Shiesty and Moneybagg discuss their weaponry and their addiction to it, while also discussing their gang affiliation and accompanying troubles with the police.

This remix was released on May 29, 2020, and is featured on Shiesty’s 1017 Eskimo label boss Gucci Mane’s fourth compilation album, So Icy Summer.

songs.full_title: Guard Up by Pooh Shiesty
songs.title: Guard Up

description.plain:
“Guard Up” is Pooh Shiesty’s first release of 2021, coming after his hit song “Back in Blood”. Both tracks are singles off of the rapper’s debut mixtape, Shiesty Season. On the TP808-produced instrumental, he brags about his weaponry and power on the streets, making it clear that he will take care of anyone who steps in his way.

Only a few hours before its release, the Memphis rapper alerted his fans of the new music along with an announcement, which revealed new information about his upcoming project.

songs.full_title: Lemonade (17 Bars with the New 1017 Freestyle) by Pooh Shiesty
songs.title: Lemonade (17 Bars with the New 1017 Freestyle)
songs.title_with_featured: Lemonade (17 Bars with the New 1017 Freestyle)

description.plain:
This is the first of six freestyles from Gucci Mane’s “The New 1017,” his label’s new generation of artists that Gucci has signed in 2019 and 2020, and Audiomack.

Gucci announced the series via his Twitter on September 8th, 2020.

This track is freestyled over the beat from Gucci Mane’s 2009 track “Lemonade,” which was produced by Bangladesh. “Lemonade” peaked at #53 on the Billboard Hot 100.

songs.full_title: Federal Contraband (Freestyle) by Pooh Shiesty
songs.title: Federal Contraband (Freestyle)

description.plain:
“Federal Contraband (Freestyle)” is a jail freestyle by the incarcerated, Memphis native rapper, Pooh Shiesty.

Despite the gritty jail phone quality, Shiesty was able to freestyle with a frequently collaborated with producer, TP808 backing the raw recording with a Trap beat.

Despite the rapper awaiting trial after being arrested for discharging a firearm during a violent crime, conspiracy, and robbery and currently facing life imprisonment, the rapper continues to speak about weapons, ammunition, and the shooting of firearms.

Despite the gritty jail phone quality, Shiesty was able to freestyle with a frequently collaborated with producer, TP808 backing the raw recording with a Trap beat.

Despite the rapper awaiting trial after being arrested for discharging a firearm during a violent crime, conspiracy, and robbery and currently facing life imprisonment, the rapper continues to speak about weapons, ammunition, and the shooting of firearms.

Glock [?] stay in my jumpsuit, poker keep scratchin' my pelvis
We shootin' dice for noodles, I went through your whole commissary, yeah, ayy
See, used to two slide on [?], blind as shit but now I see

songs.full_title: So Icy by Pooh Shiesty (Ft. K Shiday)
songs.title: So Icy

description.plain:
“So Icy” a collaboration between Pooh Shiesty and K Shiday, who are both members of Gucci Mane’s record label 1017 Eskimo. This track is the partial title track of Gucci’s fourth compilation album So Icy Summer. This is the first out of three appearances Shiday makes on So Icy Summer, following “Left on Read” as part of her group So Icy Girlz and “Iran” by Gucci.

Shiesty and Shiday rap about their legal troubles, as well as “snitching,” or telling somebody about an act somebody else committed with the intention to get the person in huge trouble. The two also rap about their choice of their opposite gender and sexual endeavors.
